incidents.name: User Session Drop in SuperSim product

incident_updates.body: Twilio SuperSim was degraded for 6  minutes between 21:09 and 21:15 PT. During this period of time customers may have experienced drop in user session. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Flex Overview Page in Admin Console Fails to Load

incident_updates.body: Twilio Flex was degraded for 1 hour between 12:00 AM and 1:00 AM Pacific Time on April 18th, 2023. During this period of time customers may have experienced loading failures when trying to access the Flex overview page in admin console. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Billing Degradation

incident_updates.body: Billing functionality has been resolved and is operating normally at this time.
Billing functionality is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified that, due to an upstream issue with one of our vendors, billing functionality is impacted, including package and product upgrades, updating billing contact information, and updating payment information. Our vendor is working on a fix, and we will confirm restoration of functionality once that fix is in place. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Twilio Billing Discrepancies for Short Code and Alpha Sender Messaging Fees

incident_updates.body: Twilio billing services for short code and alpha senders were degraded between March 22nd at 08:10 and April 7th at 13:31 Pacific Time. During this period of time customers may have seen discrepancies in message fee charges for messages sent from short code and Alpha sender IDs to a subset of countries. The issue has now been resolved. Twilio will issue the appropriate credits to the impacted accounts. Customers don’t need to take any further actions.

incidents.name: Automated Alert: Minimal Customer Impact

incidents.name: Twillio API Error Responses

incident_updates.body: Twilio SMS, MMS, Proxy, Verify, Lookup, and Proxy services were degraded for 30 minutes between 8:00 am and 8:30 am Pacific Time. During this period of time customers may have experienced issues on interaction with Twilio API with numbers to be rejected or returned with error responses. The issue has now been resolved.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Voice. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
